summary: This is a proffer agreement between Lawrence Visoski (the Client) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, setting terms for a meeting where Visoski will provide information to the government. The agreement clarifies that this is not a cooperation agreement and outlines protections and limitations on how Visoski's statements can be used in potential prosecutions.

persons.name: Lawrence Visoski
persons.context: The individual who has agreed to provide information to the government under the terms of this proffer agreement.

persons.name: Glen McGorty
persons.context: The attorney representing Lawrence Visoski in connection with the proffer meeting with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The Acting U.S. Attorney who signed the proffer agreement on behalf of the government.

connections.description: McGorty is the attorney representing Visoski in the proffer agreement process.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the government counterpart to Visoski's proffer agreement.

events.title: Proffer Meeting
events.description: A meeting held by video conference between Lawrence Visoski (and his attorney) and the U.S. Attorney's Office, where Visoski agreed to provide information to the government.

locations: Office of the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Lawrence Visoski entered into a proffer agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on October 7, 2020.
The agreement explicitly states it is NOT a cooperation agreement and does not guarantee any plea, immunity, or non-prosecution deal for Visoski.
The government agreed not to use Visoski's statements from the meeting in its case-in-chief, except in prosecutions for false statements, obstruction, perjury, or if Visoski becomes a fugitive.
The agreement was signed by Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss on behalf of the government.
